protocol: Protocol for Lap Grooming Ritual: Building Trust for Handling and Nail Care
description: This protocol teaches dogs to relax on their back in the handler's lap, accepting gentle handling of paws, ears, and mouth, gradually introducing grooming tools. The goal is to create a bonding ritual rooted in trust and calm, reminiscent of maternal care.

tasks.task: Gently guide dog onto your lap
Rest hand on chest for 3 seconds
Rest hand on belly for 5 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap
tasks.note: If dog has moved, reposition. If still in place, reward and continue.

tasks.task: Rest hand on chest for 5 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap

tasks.note: Very light touch, immediately return to belly stroking if dog tenses.

tasks.task: Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left front paw for 2 seconds

tasks.note: Back paws can be more sensitive. Go slowly.

tasks.task: Hold right front paw for 2 seconds
Hold left ear flap for 2 seconds
Hold right ear flap for 2 seconds
Hold left front paw for 3 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left back paw for 2 seconds
Hold right back paw for 2 seconds

tasks.note: Just let the dog see the clippers. No movement toward dog.

tasks.task: Hold left front paw for 3 seconds
Hold right front paw for 3 seconds
Hold left ear flap for 3 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left front paw for 5 seconds
Touch between toes on left front paw
tasks.note: Very gentle touch. This area is sensitive.

tasks.task: Hold right front paw for 5 seconds
Touch between toes on right front paw
Touch left front paw with clippers
tasks.note: Just a light touch of the closed clippers to the paw.

tasks.task: Lift left lip briefly to expose teeth
Hold right ear flap for 3 seconds
Touch right front paw with clippers
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left back paw for 3 seconds
Touch left back paw with clippers
Lift right lip briefly to expose teeth
Hold right back paw for 3 seconds
Touch right back paw with clippers
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Click clippers once in the air
tasks.note: Keep clippers away from dog. Just let them hear the sound.

tasks.task: Hold left front paw for 5 seconds
Touch toe on left front paw with clippers
Hold right front paw for 5 seconds
Touch toe on right front paw with clippers
Click clippers once in the air
Lift left lip and hold for 2 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left back paw for 5 seconds
Touch toe on left back paw with clippers
Lift right lip and hold for 2 seconds
Hold right back paw for 5 seconds
Touch toe on right back paw with clippers
Click clippers twice in the air
Gently squeeze left front paw pad
Gently squeeze right front paw pad
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Hold left front paw and show clippers simultaneously for 3 seconds
Run finger along left ear edge
Hold right front paw and show clippers simultaneously for 3 seconds
Click clippers near left front paw
tasks.note: Clippers should be visible but not touching the paw.

tasks.task: Touch inside of left ear flap
Click clippers near right front paw
Run finger along right ear edge
Gently squeeze left back paw pad
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Place clippers around nail on left front paw - no clip
tasks.note: Position clippers as if about to trim, but do not apply pressure or clip.

tasks.task: Place clippers around nail on right front paw - no clip
Gently squeeze right back paw pad
Click clippers near left back paw
Click clippers near right back paw
Touch inside of right ear flap
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Place clippers around nail on left back paw - no clip
Touch each toe individually on left front paw
Place clippers around nail on right back paw - no clip
Lift and examine left front paw for 5 seconds
Place clippers around nail and click on left front paw - no actual trim
tasks.note: This combines positioning and sound. Watch for tension.

tasks.task: Touch each toe individually on right front paw
Lift and examine right front paw for 5 seconds
Place clippers around nail and click on right front paw - no actual trim
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Lift and examine left back paw for 5 seconds
Place clippers around nail and click on left back paw - no actual trim
Lift left lip and hold for 3 seconds
Lift and examine right back paw for 5 seconds
Place clippers around nail and click on right back paw - no actual trim
Lift right lip and hold for 3 seconds
Touch each toe individually on left back paw
Touch left front paw with brush
Touch each toe individually on right back paw
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Trim single nail on left front paw
tasks.note: First actual trim. Just one nail. Reward heavily. If dog is not ready, go back to placing clippers without trimming.

tasks.task: Hold left ear flap for 5 seconds
Trim single nail on right front paw
Hold right ear flap for 5 seconds
Lift and examine left front paw for 10 seconds
Touch right front paw with brush
Lift and examine right front paw for 10 seconds
Gentle circular belly rub for 5 seconds
Gently guide dog onto your lap
Trim single nail on left back paw
tasks.note: Back paws may be more challenging. Go slowly and reward.

tasks.task: Trim single nail on right back paw
Trim second nail on left front paw
Lift left lip and hold for 5 seconds
Trim second nail on right front paw
Lift right lip and hold for 5 seconds
Gentle circular belly rub for 10 seconds
